byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting from San Francisco.

abstract: Potential buyers of bankrupt Gawker Media Group may be interested in its less visible e-commerce business; Ziff Davis reportedly has bid $90 million to $100 million for company.
lead_paragraph: Its Lifehacker, Kotaku, Kinja Deals and other sites have been generating commissions for Gawker and are of interest to Ziff Davis, a suitor.

headline.main: Gawker’s Appeal in Sale May Be Its E-Commerce Potential
headline.print_headline: Suitors Home In on Gawker’s E-Commerce Potential

snippet: Its Lifehacker, Kotaku, Kinja Deals and other sites have been generating commissions for Gawker and are of interest to Ziff Davis, a suitor.
